lines.text: The first time a good-looking Italian man pinched my bottom, I said, "This is for me!"
I simply want Bentley to think I'm a tramp - and go home.
It's way past his cheese time.
You mean, we'll never met again?
There's never any never. Kiss me.
I'm going to where they really know what love's about. To Italy. Arrivederci Briarcroft.
I'm always amazed that a few meters of chiffon, when filled by a lovely body like yours, becomes as if by magic, alive. Now, that's beautiful.
Could I ask, just one more question? What was that Italian doing with your, eh, nightgown? Trying to get - fresh?
Oh, no. He was just wondering how my body would look in it.
Oh, but you're not suggesting we play baseball. You're suggesting we make love.
Hey you, come here. I picked up this chick in Capri. Dig that figure. Too much, ain't she? Show 'em, baby. Isn't that nutty? Look at that - figure.
Come on, Miss Hot Lips of 1962.
Where do we go from here?
How would you like to ride my Vespa to the top of the world?
You tell me how close I have to get, before it starts tickling.
Alright. I'll try.
Tickle yet?
Not yet.
Now?
Almost.
Now?
Oh, yes, now!
Lots of danger around the lips.

Brazen hussy. You see how she leaped out for him? Couldn't even wait, poor thing. Oh, look there's a real heartbreaker. Look. He's going after two of those little, lonely girls. He's going to take them, one after another. Ha-ha. Look. They jumped out to meet him.
Where to now, my lord and master?
When the rain stops, I shall show you Verona.
Oh, Romeo and Julietsville.
Excuse me, but I can tell you are an American from behind.
When you want love music, what do you ask for, Prudence?
Have you ever made love to The Stars and Stripes Forever?
No, I can't say I have.
You haven't lived.
Thanks for wiping my windshield. It was all fogged up!
